item.title: Why Elden Ring's Amazing New Sales Milestone Likely Won't Be Its Last
item.description:
Summary

  • Elden Ring continues to break records with 30 million copies sold globally, exceeding all expectations.
  • Dark Souls Remastered on Switch hints at Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition potential sales boost on Switch 2.
  • Switch 2 pre-orders are soaring, raising concerns about Nintendo's image amid price increases.

Elden Ring has just hit another major milestone, as the 2022 Game of the Year continues to grow in the years after its release. This is thanks in part to a number of major updates over the years, including a free Colosseum update in 2023 and Shadow of the Erdtree in 2024, a major DLC that received its own nomination for Game of the Year. With Nightreign also slated to release later in May, it’s clear that Elden Ring shows no sign of slowing down this growth.

FromSoftware, the developer of Elden Ring , has found some of this success with Nintendo. It has released Dark Souls Remastered for the Switch, and has partnered with Nintendo to develop an exclusive Bloodborne -style action RPG for the Switch 2. Sales numbers show that Dark Souls Remastered sold over 1.1 million copies on the Switch alone, versus nearly 3.4 million copies across all platforms. The Switch version of Dark Souls Remastered did launch to some controversy by only supporting 30fps instead of the standard 60fps, but it didn’t stop it from pulling in nearly 30% of the Remaster’s sales. That spells good news for Elden Ring when it makes its way to the Switch 2.

Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition for Switch 2 Geared to Boost FromSoftware Sales

Elden Ring recently hit 30 million copies sold worldwide. The Dark Souls trilogy, by comparison, has sold a combined 37 million copies, and Elden Ring ’s sales are now equivalent to those of 2019’s Call of Duty: Modern Warfare Remaster. It has exceeded every critical and commercial expectation, swept game awards across the globe, now has its own spin-off, and soon, Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition will be coming to the Switch 2.

Going off of the sales numbers for Dark Souls Remastered on the Switch versus the Remaster’s total sales, it’s possible for Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition to pull in an extra 5-10 million in sales for FromSoftware. Playing Elden Ring on Switch 2 may come with a catch, but that could also keep the price from getting too high. Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition will also not be a part of the starting lineup for Switch 2, which has the potential to either soften or heighten anticipation, but will afford FromSoftware the time to fine-tune the game to the Switch 2’s specifications.

The biggest hurdle FromSoftware might face is not the conversion to the Switch 2 — it has its experience with Dark Souls Remastered to look back on — but the price tag. The Switch 2 is priced at $449, and Switch 2 games will be priced between $70-80, with physical copies climbing as high as $90. That’s a big step up from the Switch’s launch price of $299 with $60 games. Fans have questioned whether the technological advancement between the Switch and the Switch 2 will justify this increase in price, and it has begged larger questions about Nintendo’s image as the gaming industry’s consumer-friendly brand.

Switch 2 Controversies Are Not Slowing Down Sales

Regardless of these obstacles, Nintendo’s long-anticipated system is set to become one of the gaming giant’s best-selling consoles. Switch 2 pre-orders have hit historic levels in France, according to Fnac multimedia and gaming director Charlotte Massicault. After the first wave of preorders opened in the United States on April 24th, the Switch 2 sold out across virtually all major retailers, including Walmart, Target, and GameStop. The more expensive $499 Mario Kart World Bundle was seven times more popular than the standalone console. This may be because it guaranteed gamers at least one game at a discount, or it may be because Nintendo deliberately shipped more bundles than standalones.

Whatever the case may be, Switch 2’s presale numbers measure well against Elden Ring ’s recent 30-million-unit sales milestone. No definitive release date has been set, but it’s known that Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition will release sometime in 2025 for the Switch 2. It will include the base game along with Shadow of the Erdtree , as well as new weapons, armor skins for Torrent, and other new additions to Elden Ring .

ELDEN RING, developed by FromSoftware, Inc. and BANDAI NAMCO Entertainment Inc., is a fantasy action-RPG adventure set within a world created by Hidetaka Miyazaki and George R.R. Martin. Danger and discovery lurk around every corner in FromSoftware’s largest game to date. Hidetaka Miyazaki - President and Game Director of FromSoftware Inc. Known for directing critically-acclaimed games in beloved franchises including Armored Core and Dark Souls.

George R.R. Martin is the #1 New York Times bestselling author of many novels, including the acclaimed series A Song of Ice and Fire - A Game of Thrones, A Clash of Kings, A Storm of Swords, A Feast For Crows, and A Dance with Dragons. As a writer-producer, he has worked on The Twilight Zone, Beauty and the Beast, and various feature films and pilots that were never made. He lives with the lovely Parris in Santa Fe, New Mexico.

item.title: Genshin Impact Officially Reveals First Half Banners for Version 5.6
item.description:
Summary

  • Version 5.6 in Genshin Impact features Flagship Event in Fontaine with new characters like Layla and Ororon.
  • The lineup for the first half of Version 5.6 includes Navia, Escoffier, Layla, Ororon, and Ifa.
  • Players can expect new Chronicled Banners, synergy opportunities, and potential meta shifts with characters like Escoffier and Skirk.

Genshin Impact has officially revealed the lineup for the first half of Version 5.6, confirming that Navia and Escoffier will be accompanied by Layla, Ororon, and Ifa. While Version 5.6 centers around the Traveler's return to Mondstadt, the Flagship Event takes place in Fontaine – featuring beloved characters like Navia and Furina interacting with the cast of Natlan for the first time. Among the tourists, Genshin Impact players can expect to see Kinich, Ifa, and Ororon, who will be swept up in a storyline that also brings Neuvillette and Wriothesley back to the spotlight.

The Flagship Event is set up in a way to support the Event Banners of Version 5.6. An important thing to note is that Version 5.6 will also introduce a new Chronicled Banner to Genshin Impact , this time featuring an assortment of Inazuma characters. Players who prefer Ayaka over the upcoming Skirk can potentially obtain her and Escoffier for a premium Freeze team. As for Navia, she continues to be a versatile Geo hypercarry, capable of keeping up with the current meta.

The official Genshin Impact account shared the banner characters for the first half of Version 5.6 on Reddit, providing players with an overview of the 4-Stars that will accompany Escoffier and Navia. While Ifa was already confirmed for the first half, Layla and Ororon are a pleasant surprise in terms of the value they bring. Even between Citlali and Zhongli, Layla in Genshin Impact continues to shine as a Shield Support, while Ororon is not only one of the best Electro off-fielders, but he has amazing synergy with Ifa.

Genshin Impact: First Half Event Banners for Version 5.6

  • Escoffier – 5-Star Cryo Polearm
  • Navia – 5-Star Geo Claymore
  • Layla – 5-Star Cryo Sword
  • Ororon – 5-Star Electro Bow
  • Ifa – 5-Star Anemo Catalyst

Thanks to earlier datamining, Genshin Impact players can now determine the full lineup for the second half of the update as well. Kinich and Raiden will be paired up once again, but they will also be joined by Thoma, Sara, and Lynette. In terms of synergy, Kinich will definitely want Thoma as his Shield Support, and Sara has been a classic teammate to Raiden ever since her debut. That being said, unless players desire a particular Genshin Impact character in Version 5.6, the best investment for the long term would be Escoffier.

Players will not only be able to provide Skirk, who is on the way in Version 5.7, with her best teammate, but they will also be able to prepare for any future Cryo (or even Hydro) hypercarry. The state of Cryo has been dire in Genshin Impact , and many fans are hoping that Escoffier and Skirk will drag it back into the meta. While the numbers appear to be there, it remains to be seen if the gameplay will match.

item.title: Genshin Impact: All Nod-Krai Factions, Explained
item.description:
Summary

  • Nod-Krai in Snezhnaya is rife with factions, including the nefarious Fatui, Frostmoon Scions, and Wild Hunt.
  • The Hexenzirkel consists of powerful witches, including well-known figures like Rhinedottir and the mysterious Octavia.
  • The Lightkeepers, Voynich Guild, and Knights of Favonius play crucial roles in defending Nod-Krai against threats like The Wild Hunt.

Nod-Krai is a sub-region that lies on the southernmost tip of Snezhnaya, known for its autonomous views and harsh living conditions. Genshin Impact has been teasing the area for quite some time, and with the upcoming livestream, players can expect a generous amount of lore. The area is considered to be unsafe, as it’s steaming with thieves, monsters, and various types of organisms infected by the Abyss.

Despite this, the region houses many citizens from various backgrounds who all share a variety of beliefs. They’re all divided into factions that they represent, and it’s been confirmed that Nod-Krai has 11 factions residing in it . Each of these factions are fighting for control over the region and the power it holds. Genshin Impact players can expect to see old and new factions in Nod-Krai; here’s what you need to know about them.

The Fatui

The Fatui needs no introduction, as most Genshin Impact players have already familiarized themselves with the Tsaritsa’s closest allies. The Fatui Harbingers have been known to concoct drastic schemes to obtain the Archon’s Gnosis, but after the events of Natlan, all the Harbingers have been commanded to return to Snezhnaya and take over Nod-Krai. Their presence may look like assistance to the struggle that the citizens are facing, but their end goal is to mop up the remains and establish a stronghold once the fight is over.

It seems Genshin Impact players will get to meet either Pierro or Dottore during this time. Dottore’s presence has been confirmed by Mavuika in the epilogue of Natlan’s Archon Story, as it seems the eccentric doctor uses Nod-Krai as a research base for his experiments. Unfortunately, the reason as to how he acquired it is not as sincere as one would hope, and the Fatui Harbingers' connection to the rest of the factions can be considered as extortion. However, this is purely speculation through artifact descriptions; players will have to wait for Version 6.0 to find out more.

The Frostmoon Scions

There is a lot to unpack when it comes to the Frostmoon Scions, and what we know so far is purely speculation from artifact and weapon descriptions. The only concrete thing we have about them is the fact that the Frostmoon Scions are descendants of the ‘legendary golden realm,’ which one can assume is HyperBorea. If Genshin Impact players were unaware, HyperBorea was once an ancient land that was inhabited by an ancient civilization who were known to wield the purest form of power. The city has been dubbed the “Golden City” due to the divine power that resides there. Unfortunately, it seems that the Frostmoon Scions are no longer its citizens and had to abandon their home after the First Cryo Archon tried to hunt them down to extinction. It has been speculated that he was jealous of their power and wanted to control them.

Moreover, it can also be speculated that the Frostmoon Scions are descendants of the oldest civilization in Teyvat, the same civilization that existed before the Primordial One came and reshaped the land. This is also one of the reasons they pose a huge threat to the Tsaritsa and the citizens of Snezhnaya. Not only does their divine land supposedly exist in Snezhnaya, but they are also the most powerful entities to walk on Teyvat to this day. Mavuika has confirmed that their power even predates the seven elements, so one can assume that they may be even more powerful than the Dragon Sovereigns.

Despite their tragic background, the Frostmoon Scions had to flee to Nod-Krai and now reside in the forests of the region, fighting for their lives and providing help whenever they can. As they’re descendants of HyperBorea, this also means they are worshipers of the Moon Goddess.

The Wild Hunt

The Wild Hunt is basically the Abyss army, and it’s safe to say that they’ll be the main antagonists of Nod-Krai. The Abyss has been expanding, no doubt under the influence of the Traveler’s sibling, and they want to take over the land because they're searching for the power that the Moon Sisters once held. Genshin Impact players should be aware that The Wild Hunt has existed since before the Cataclysm and the establishment of the Abyssal Order. It is from this that we can assume that the usual Abyss enemies we see in Teyvat are not the same as The Wild Hunt.

The Wild Hunt’s attacks on Nod-Krai have been occurring for centuries, and they all appear to be orchestrated by a leader who wields Abyssal power. It’s a known fact that it's not only the Abyss who have experience of this power, as the reason for Khaenri’ah’s downfall was the misuse of abyssal power. Thus, it can be speculated that the leader of The Wild Hunt may very well be Rerir, one of the most mysterious of the Five Sinners. His name directly translates into ‘Moon Hunter,’ and since Nod-Krai is all about the Moon Sisters and Moon Power, it’s safe to say there is some sort of link there.

The Hexenzirkel

The Hexenzirkel is a faction that has been around for centuries and a silent player in the Traveler’s journey since Version 1.0. We know a lot about them, but not as much as we would like. The faction consists of a group of witches who conduct Irminsul explorations, and there are currently only eight members. Each of them has different roles; here’s what we know so far:

  • Alice - She founded the Hexenzirkel. She’s also Klee’s mother and has been away for quite some time, as the borders of Teyvat have grown weak. Her powers are near limitless, and her long lifespan has given her the chance to traverse the world and experience a variety of things.
  • Barbeloth - She’s also known as the Goddess of Prophecy and a Mage skilled enough to read the fortunes of not only nations but the entire world itself. She was Mona’s mentor as well.
  • Andersdotter - Andersdotter was one of the humans in the Hexenzirkel, which makes her the first member to pass away due to her shortened lifespan. Genshin Impact players may recognize her from the Simulanka event, as she’s the creator of Durin. She’s also the author of the famed novel Boar Princess, which can be found in Mondstadt’s Library.
  • I. Ivanovna N - Like Andersdotter, Ivanovna was also a human who was part of the Hexenzirkel. What many may not know is that she was also the first mayor of Snezhnaya and quite ‘ordinary’ in comparison to her peers. She left the Hexenzirkel after she fell in love with a man, and although she passed away centuries ago, she left her title to her line of successors.
  • Nicole - Seems to be a prophetess who follows the direction and order of Teyvat. There’s not a lot of information on Nicole yet, and all we know so far is that she is physically mute and often speaks into people’s minds.
  • Rhinedottir - One of the most important members of the Hexenzirkel, Rhinedottir is a well-known practitioner of the Art of Khemia. She’s the creator of Albedo, Durin (the shadow dragon), Rifthounds, and many other creatures. She’s also one of the Five Sinners of Khaenri’ah, so her place in Teyvat is extremely controversial due to her link to the Cataclysm 500 years ago. In the Hexenzirkel she’s described as ‘a flower that is not of this world’ - signifying there’s a chance that she’s not originally from Teyvat.
  • Octavia - Very little is known about Octavia and her origins. She seems to be a wanderer, traveling the world after she lost her home. It’s not confirmed whether she’s from Teyvat or not, but it has been stated that she has seen the ‘sky beyond the sky.’
  • Unknown - The final member is unknown.

The Lightkeepers

Not much has been officially said about the Lightkeepers, except for them being an ancient organization that has been around to defend Nod-Krai from The Wild Hunt. They were founded by the Torchforger, and it seems that this was only possible with the help of the Moonchildren. This power allowed them to keep The Wild Hunt at bay in ancient times and help Snezhnaya defend against the Abyss - perhaps in exchange for this autonomy that we see today. The Torchforger wanted Nod-Krai to become a ‘paradise’ for the people, but this all changed during the Cataclysm.

The Fatui were sent to Nod-Krai, and instead of honoring the oath the Lightkeepers had with the previous Tsaritsa, the Palestar Edict was commanded, and no help was sent. The Fatui were simply there to help clean up the mess once the Abyss finished attacking the Lightkeepers.

The Voynich Guild

Every region needs a governmental body, and the Voynich Guild is basically Nod-Krai’s version of it. However, though they are called a ‘governmental body,’ they aren’t really one. Instead, they are Nod-Krai’s strongest force, existing to maintain order. They don’t lead; they control, and everything is run by one woman.

The Knights of Favonius

The Knights of Favonius are pretty self-explanatory; they are the elite force led by Grand Master Varka. They, too, are on a mission to find the truth behind the ancient power, and after traveling the entirety of Snezhnaya, they finally make their way to Nod-Krai.

The Treasure Hoarders

The Treasure Hoarders have been an organization that has been circulating Teyvat for quite some time, but despite their enigmatic insignia, not much has been revealed about them until recently. The organization actually originated in Nod-Krai and has since spread throughout the rest of Teyvat. It was created by Reed Miller, a legendary thief and treasure hunter who wished to create ‘a world without boundaries.’ Unfortunately, Reed was eventually executed for his crimes, but before he was taken away, he left behind a ‘great treasure’ buried somewhere in Nod-Krai.

We can speculate on the treasure left behind by Reed Miller by looking closer into the insignia of the Treasure Hoarders. One can theorize that the symbol in the middle looks similar to the four-pointed star that represents Khaenri’ah - perhaps hinting that the treasure is related to this lost civilization. Moreover, the star could even relate to the Traveler, as this is the animation we see when the Traveler lands in Teyvat. There is talk that the treasure could even be the Traveler’s original sword.

The Snowland Fae

The Snowland Fae are quite the important faction in Nod-Krai and are known to be a magical race in Snezhnaya. These Fae were the followers of the First Cryo Archon, Belyi Tsar (Tsarbelyi), and something akin to what Oceanids were to Egeria (the first Hydro Archon). It’s because of this that they have great influence over Snezhnaya’s court, but one cannot assume the position they have in the present is similar to the recognition they had in the past.

The Adventurers’ Guild

Everyone is familiar with the Adventurers' Guild and Katheryne when visiting new regions. However, Nod-Krai is a little different, as it seems that the Adventurers’ Guild Headquarters is in Nod-Krai. Players may also get to meet the head of the Guild, who may or may not be Sandrone - one of the Fatui Harbingers.

The Clink-Clank Krumkake Craftshop

Not many details have been given out regarding the Krumkake Craftshop except for the fact that it might be a Cookie Workshop. The description states that it has also become a machine workshop, so players will have to just wait and see what it brings to the table once the area releases.

item.title: Xbox's Rising Prices Could Float All Boats
item.description:
A recent announcement from Microsoft has revealed that the price of all first-party Xbox hardware and software will be increasing. The price of Xbox consoles and accessories rose on May 1, 2025, with the specific amount differing between regions, and certain games will cost $80 towards the end of 2025.

Microsoft has cited that increasing costs of development and market conditions are the driving forces for this change. However, considering the recent controversy surrounding the high cost of Switch 2 games, this move may set a worrying precedent that the rest of the industry will follow, and one that players may not be able to easily keep up with.

Sony Might Follow Microsoft and Nintendo’s Lead

With its two main competitors matching each other’s game prices, it is likely that Sony will feel incentivized to follow with its first-party PlayStation games. While the community has mostly been disappointed with the increased cost of Xbox and Switch 2 games, the reluctant willingness of some fans to adhere to the changes is likely to have caujmnkghjuht Sony’s attention. In April, Sony already raised the price of PlayStation Plus in some regions for reasons similar to those stated by Microsoft, so players are likely to hear of a price hike for its first-party titles soon.

This emerging trend is one that many players have already been treating as an inevitability. While price matching and competition are both factors, Sony has already been increasing its prices incrementally. As well as raising its subscription prices, the cost of PS5 consoles increased across multiple regions in April 2025. Though Microsoft revealed its pricing changes in bulk, it seems Sony has instead been making alterations to its prices gradually, so a price hike for PlayStation games may be a matter of when, not if.

How the Price Hike Could Discourage Players

As well as aiming to meet rising industry costs and expectations, there are other reasons given for these increasing prices. Nintendo defends its decision, claiming that Mario Kart World provides experiences that justify the price. Using price as a marker of content quality, Microsoft – and possibly Sony – may feel an obligation to increase the price and prove that its own games provide as much value as Nintendo’s products.

To many players, they do not feel as though price is reflective of a game’s quality. Particularly for indie games, this lower price point is more inviting to players, especially in the wake of increasing prices. In spite of its indie status, Balatro was nominated for Game of the Year, competing against AAA games with higher budgets. Increasing the cost does not always mean that players believe they are paying for a premium experience, and could encourage them instead to search for more affordable indie games that have just as much quality.

Sony Could Subvert Expectations

There is a chance, then, that Sony will differentiate itself from the rest of the industry and stand by its lower price point. This could be a bold move, winning players over by continuing to sell products at a price that is more accessible to the average consumer. There may be some evidence to support this: the former PlayStation head Shawn Layden commented on Nintendo’s prices, claiming that the cost of Switch 2 games is justifiable because of the exclusivity of Nintendo’s IPs to the console. Now that many first-party PlayStation games are available on PC, this lack of exclusivity may mean that Sony increasing its prices is not as reasonable. If the publisher’s views still align with Layden’s perspective, the cost of PlayStation games might not move at all.

High Prices Could Incentivize Subscriptions

The price hike of games across the industry may have an influence on consumer behavior, which could be an intentional strategic move by these publishers. Players who are dissuaded by the increasing costs of first-party software may instead be encouraged by the lower prices of the subscription services each offers. Microsoft proudly boasts that many of its games are available on day one to Game Pass subscribers at no extra cost to their standard subscription. It is possible that the price hikes may incentivize more players to subscribe instead.

Each of these companies is making concerted efforts to promote its subscription services with added benefits. Nintendo fans have been eagerly waiting for GameCube games to be added to the Nintendo Switch Online Expansion Pass, and now, these will be included exclusively for the Switch 2. However, there is one new benefit to the service that may be intended to soften the impact of the high prices – Switch 2 Edition upgrades for two Zelda games. These upgrades were initially a point of contention for some fans, but adding them as a Switch Online perk for users with the Expansion Pack may convince players to subscribe rather than pay for each upgrade. This could be something Microsoft and Sony could learn from, adding more perks to convince more people to subscribe.

Pushing for more players to move away from physical releases towards subscriptions may be worrying to some. Nintendo and Microsoft increasing game prices to $80 has made these titles less accessible to more people, and by improving Nintendo Switch Online and Game Pass, it is possible that, if prices continue to increase, subscribing may be the only affordable option for many. This is concerning to some, especially after Sony attempted to remove paid digital content from consumers in 2023. Though it was able to rectify the concerns of the community in this specific instance, many players became aware that their digital libraries may not be owned by them. If Sony increases its game prices, it may influence players to subscribe instead, renting games at a lower price rather than waiting for their purchases to eventually be taken from them.

With the announcement that Xbox games will match the Switch 2 by the end of 2025, it is likely to push Sony to make a statement of its own. Given the increasing price of PlayStation hardware and PlayStation Plus, some may expect that its first-party games will match its competitors. Nonetheless, there is still a chance to surprise players by remaining affordable and setting itself apart from Nintendo and Microsoft.

item.title: Diablo 4: How Do Reliquaries Work?
item.description:
The Reliquary system in Diablo 4 offers players a different way to earn cosmetic items as they play through the game. First introduced in Season 8, Reliquaries offer more or less the same items one would expect from a typical battle pass, but the key difference here is in how players earn such items.

Getting stuff from Reiliquaries can be a bit confusing, but once you know what to do, it's actually quite simple. If you're wondering how to unlock items from this sytem, here's a quick Diablo 4 guide on how it works.

What are Reliquaries in Diablo 4?

Basically, the Reliquary system is a total overhaul of the old Diablo 4 battle pass . It still contains the regular array of Armory cosmetic items and premium currency, but now, items are separated by category, and players will need to spend Platinum in order to unlock said categories. There are still free cosmetics to be earned, but much like before, the majority of items are locked behind a real-money paywall.

Instead of playing the game to earn Battle Pass XP, players must now earn a new type of in-game currency called Favor Tokens . These are used to buy items inside the Reiliquaries themselves.

A Reliquary contains a number of items, and once you buy all of them, you can get a special bonus item from that specific Reliquary. You won't need to spend any extra tokens for that bonus item.

Season 8 Reliquaries

In Season of Belial's Return , players can choose from the following Reliquaries:

  • Belial's Return - Free
  • Weapons - 200 Platinum
  • Beasts - 500 Platinum
  • Armor - 800 Platinum

The good thing about the Reliquaries system is you can skip the categories you don't want and just purchase the ones that interest you, letting you save a bit of Platinum. If you want to get all the items, you'll need to cough up 1000 Platinum, which is the same price as the Premium Battle Pass from previous seasons.

How to Get Favor Tokens

You can get Favor Tokens by defeating enemies and completing quests . Players can only hold up to 99 Favor Tokens at a time, and if they reach that cap, they won't be able to earn any additional tokens. However, tokens will carry over between seasons — if you're not too keen on getting what's currently being offered, you can choose to just save your Favor Tokens for next time.

Favor Tokens can be earned and spent regardless of if a player is playing in the Seasonal or Eternal realm.
